item.title: The Fourfold Task
item.description: The four truths on Buda’s teachings are stated: Existence is suffering The origin of suffering is craving The ceasing of suffering is the ceasing of craving The way to the ceasing of craving is the noble eightfold path After contemplating these truths, one is to accept the four noble tasks: Suffering is to be fully known What arises is to be let go of The ceasing is to be beheld The way is to be cultivated Early Buddhism and the Four Great Vows, a seminar with Stephen Batchelor, 4 March 2017
